TopicTitle: HMS Queen Elizabeth Class Battleship [CHALLENGE: KILL IT AND RECEIVE A REWARD!]

Articles.Content:
HMS Queen Elizabeth Class Battleship!

This 1170 part, 185 ton battleship is the monster of the Kerbal fleet. With 8 missiles on 4 working turrets and 12 missiles on fixed amidships guns, this ship will rule the seas. It also has a long range "walrus" missile launched just aft of amidships. Press "1" to toggle all the little masts on top, Press "2" to toggle the main engines, and hit "U" to turn on Bridge and search lights. Press "3" several times to toggle the signal lights on the side.

WARNING! Ships of this size have killed computers before (The Fleet Master can vouch for that), so if you do not run KSP with the best settings, DO BE CAREFUL! Also there are no wheels on it, so use the debug menu/ hyperedit to get it to water.

Max Speed: 20 m/s (Don't go over this it tends to break)

Cruising (safe) speed: 10 m/s

Turn just by hitting the left or right turn, it's slow but stable.

Download: https://www./?a3858aiacc1ut81

New challenge! If you can kill this ship, I'll give you the BRAND NEW Missile-Carrying version early, before ANYONE ELSE GETS IT!

PERSIST HERE: https://www./?9cfhn4f5kq6n4t5

You need to absolutely smash the QEII. No just knocking off the engines, i mean split it into peices, knock out its power, control, or flip it. That doesn't mean throwing it at the ground. I mean, KILL IT WITH WEAPONS. No hacky stuff. GO! (also, I CRAVE PICS so don't forget those )

Not trying to hijack this thread. Do you want to try out my ship, zekes? I can release the craft soon. This is my most favored ship.

Introducing, the Basalt cruise missile. It has a very low rcs signature along with a lightly shielded engine section to reduce heat emissions for ir sensors. It is very accurate and has a range easily exceeding 100 km. RATO boosters are also used on take off.

The LCS Independence can make extremely tight turns at over 32 m/s. Part count with weapons, including advanced cruise missiles, is 400.

The trimaran hull really does reduce hydrodynamic drag. Thank you for the R & D, General Dynamics.

One of the wheels I used to drive into the water got stuck and quickly took off a part of the ship. I was surprised to see it still going after loosing a large part of the internal hull, and it still handled better than any of my other ships!
